data.title: Hundreds of golf balls fall from helicopter at Blossom of Hope's Pink Greens Golf event
data.meta_description: A helicopter hovered over the practice area at Turf Valley Golf club and dropped a chopper full of golf balls onto the green Thursday morning.The person whose
data.text:
A chopper hovered over the Turf Valley Golf club and dropped hundreds of golf balls onto the green Thursday morning.

The person whose ball lands closest to the pin wins $2,000 and the furthest wins $500.

ALSO READ |

This is a first-time event at our Pink Greens Golf Tournament, said Vera Simmons, Executive Director in a news release. We always have a lot of fun at this event, with this yearâ€™s theme centered around pirates, matey. We thought this would be a fun addition to something people really enjoy each year anyway. After all, hundreds of golf balls dropping from a helicopter is a sight to be seen!

Blossoms of Hope is known for the 2,900 cherry, redbud, and dogwood trees that bloom each year in Howard County as well as the more than the $800,000 it has donated to local nonprofits in the county including the Claudia Mayer/Tina Broccolino Cancer Resource Center; Gilchrist Hospice; Ellicott City Partnership, Zaching Against Cancer, Respite Retreats, Bright Minds, ARC, Community Schools Program, and Camp Attaway, to name a few.

The Pink Greens Golf Tournament is one of five events Blossoms of Hope holds each year to raise fund for our community support and individual programs, said Simmons in a news release. Pink Greens, which will begin right after the helicopter drop, is always fun with participants encouraged to dress to the theme and have a fun day in addition to a great golfing experience.

Two new initiatives this year include a countywide art show and Seeds of Hope, a program that invests in the well-being of Howard County, fostering community resilience, and addressing mental health challenges through education, awareness, collaboration, and support for local institutions.

ALSO READ |

For more information on the helicopter drop or about Blossoms of Hope, visit or call Vera at 443-280-2590.
